[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_block_data.rs] [Function: parent_id()] [Cached Hash Inconsistency] Does parent_id() on line 60-62 cache the hash value, or is it recomputed each call - could cached values become stale if parent field is modified? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_block_data.rs] [Function: parent()] [Reference Lifetime Safety] The parent() method on line 64-66 returns &BlockInfo - can this reference outlive the OptBlockData, allowing access to potentially invalidated parent data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_block_data.rs] [Function: round()] [Round Read Atomicity] Is round() on line 72-74 atomic when called concurrently with modifications to self.round field from multiple threads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_block_data.rs] [Struct: OptBlockData] [Field Initialization Order] Does the order of field initialization in new() (lines 42-52) matter for safety, or can reordering fields create temporary invalid states exploitable by concurrent code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_block_data.rs] [Struct: OptBlockData] [Clone Safety] OptBlockData derives Clone on line 21 - can cloning create aliased mutable references to parent or block_body that violate validation invariants? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_block_data.rs] [Function: new()] [Grandparent QC Consistency] Does new() validate that grandparent_qc.certified_block() matches the grandparent of parent BlockInfo, or can mismatched grandparents create invalid chain structures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_block_data.rs] [Function: verify_well_formed()] [Error Handling Bypass] The function uses anyhow::ensure! macros that return Err - can calling code ignore these errors and continue processing invalid OptBlockData? (High)
